{#innervation} *There are no bony insertions for the muscles of facial expression @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 **All muscles of facial expression are innervated by the facial nerve (CN VII) via temporal, zygomatic, buccal, mandibular, or cervical branches arising from the parotid plexus @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ::: ## Muscles of Mastication ::: {#tbl-primary-mastication-oian .cell message='false' Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Digastric Hyoid: Elevation (during swallowing)
TMJ: Assists with opening mandible
Geniohyoid
Mylohyoid Oral floor: Tighten, Elevation
Hyoid: Draws forward (during swallowing)
TMJ: Assists with opening mandible, Side-to-side movement during mastication
Stylohyoid Hyoid: Elevation (during swallowing)
TMJ: Assists with opening mandible

Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Platysma
Sternocleidomastoid Manubrium
Medial third of Clavicle		 Mastoid process
Superior nuchal line		 CN XI Accessory n.
Cervical plexus
C1 - C4		 Unilateral: I/L cervical sidebend, C/L cervical rotation
Bilateral: Head extension, Cervical Flexion, Assists in respiration, Prevents posterior translation during mastication
SCJ stabilization
Upper trapezius Occiput
SP C1-C7		 lateral 1/3 of Clavicle Accessory n. (CN XI)
C3 - C4		 Scapula: Elevation, Upward rotatino
Neck: I/L sidebend, C/L Rotation
